oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quantification of leaf stripe, Pyrenophora graminea, in barley seed by real-time PCR
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Justesen, A.F.
Hansen, H.J.
Pinnschmidt, H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In some years, large amounts of organic seed lots are discarded due to the presence of high levels of seed-borne diseases. In barley it is especially the presence of the fungal species Pyrenophora teres (barley net blotch) and P. graminea (barley leaf stripe), which causes rejection of seed lots. A real-time PCR method for detection and quantification of P. graminea has been developed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Justesen, A.F.; Hansen, H.J. and Pinnschmidt, H. (2005) Quantification of leaf stripe, Pyrenophora graminea, in barley seed by real-time PCR. In: Abstract booklet, 5th ISTA-SHC Seed Health Symposium, p. 20.
